title: 115_hr2741
content: The Act may be cited as the "Bettering Resources In Guarding from Human Trafficking Act of 2017" or the "BRIGHT Act of 2017". Mandatory minimums for certain trafficking offenses are established. The text amends sections of title 18, United States Code related to peonage, vessels for slave trade, and enticement into slavery by increasing minimum imprisonment sentences. The text amends sections of title 18, United States Code related to peonage, vessels for slave trade, and enticement into slavery by increasing minimum imprisonment sentences to not less than five years and not more than 20 years. The amendments to sections of title 18, United States Code increase minimum imprisonment sentences for offenses related to peonage, vessels for slave trade, and transportation of slaves from the United States to not less than one year and not more than 10 years. The amendments to sections of title 18, United States Code increase minimum imprisonment sentences for offenses related to peonage, vessels for slave trade, and transportation of slaves to not less than five years and not more than 20 years. Amendment to section 1592(a) of title 18, United States Code increases minimum imprisonment to not less than 5 years for unlawful conduct related to documents in trafficking, peonage, slavery, involuntary servitude, or forced labor. The amendment to section 1592(a) of title 18, United States Code increases the minimum imprisonment for unlawful conduct related to trafficking in persons. Offenders who restrict a person's liberty for labor purposes or violate section 1591 will face fines and imprisonment ranging from one to ten years.
